resources.string:
The names and locations of about 7700 airports from around the world are loaded from a data file (provided by OpenFlights.org) and stored in a list. 

The location of an airport can then be extracted from the list and used in a request to the Google Time Zone API to obtain the hourly offset from GMT at that airport location. The date and time inputted alongside an airport are also passed as parameters in the timezone request to accurately account for the local daylight savings time offset at any given date. 

With accurate timezone offsets at hand, these can be used to convert the inputted departure and arrival times to equivalent GMT times. 

Then, the number of hours since midnight at departure can then be subtracted from the number of hours since midnight at arrival. Added onto this result is 24 for each day passed, which yields the total hourly duration of the flight. 

Repeating this calculation for each inputted flight and adding the results up will give the entire duration of the trip. 

The layover duration is simply calculated as the time between arriving on one flight and departing on the next.

This section aims to inform you of my policies regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information in the App. 

The collection of personal information collected in the App plays a key role in providing the core functionality of the App.
By using the App you agree to the collection and use of your information in relation to this policy as well as the Google Privacy Policy.

When using the App, you may directly provide the following flight information. 

Departure airport(s), departure date(s), departure time(s), arrival airport(s), arrival date(s) and arrival time(s). 

This information can be entered via text inputs that exist throughout the user interface. All information provided by the user will be retained on the user's device and not collected by me in any way. 

The geographical coordinates of any provided airports, along with any provided date and time information, may be used in requests to the Google Time Zone API, as part of the Google Maps API. In such cases, Google may receive access to the information.
